description: Largest odd number that can be represented in exactly n ways as p+2*i^2 where p is 1 or a prime and i >= 0.
comments: These are just the largest numbers presently known - it has not been proved that they are really the largest.
links: L. Hodges, A lesser-known Goldbach conjecture, Math. Mag., 66 (1993), 45-47.
Index entries for sequences related to Goldbach conjecture
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: The sequence as given in the Hodge paper is incorrect. Corrected and extended by _Jud McCranie_ Jun 12, 2000
